item.title: Shell completion with Cobra and Go
item.description: You probably use a CLI on a daily basis. Depending on the solution the CLI works, the number of available options can be overwhelming. Because no visual recognition is available, we depend on the help to find the correct arguments.

item.title: Build Systems with Go v0.2.0 is here!!!
item.description: Build Systems with Go has exceeded all my expectations. Actually, I started the book with no expectations or predefined goals. It has been for one month the number one in the Amazon new releases in the category of distributed systems.

item.title: Using the Kafka REST API with Go
item.description: This post is an adaption of a fragment extracted from my book Build systems with Go: everything a Gopher must know". You can find more details here. Apache Kafka has demonstrated to be a scalable solution and it is widely adopted as a publish/subscribe event streaming platform.

item.title: Log your Go projects with Zerolog
item.description: In the 21st century, any decent software project must use a logger. One of the worst presents a software engineer can receive is a project using print statements. This is wrong.

item.title: Golang features newbies (and not so newbies) may find weird
item.description: It has been three years now since I started coding in Go. I think it is time for a bit of retrospective and I would like to enumerate some of the aspects I found most “weird” during my Golang learning process.
